metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12392 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The 'Copy as cURL' feature of Devtools' network tab did not properly escapethe HTTP POST data of a request, which can be controlled by the website. Ifa user used the 'Copy as cURL' feature and pasted the command into aterminal, it could have resulted in the disclosure of local files. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox < 76, and Thunderbird <68.8.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12392` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '76.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
